intro: Camelina longistyla, commonly known as the long-styled camelina, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The species is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. Its most distinctive feature is the elongated, slender style of its pistil, which gives it its scientific name. Camelina longistyla is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
